tool_help.description: Get detailed help information for a specific tool, including its parameters and usage examples.

tool_name.description: The name of the tool to get help for

get_background_update_status.description: Get the status information and statistics of the background incremental update thread for code repository monitoring to track automatic code indexing updates.

file_search.description: Fast file search based on fuzzy matching against file path. Use if you know part of the file path but don't know where it's located exactly.

delete_file.description: Deletes a file at the specified path. The operation will fail gracefully if the file doesn't exist.

target_file.description: The path of the file to delete, relative to the workspace root.

get_sensor_data.description: Acquire physical world information including images, videos, audio, and sensor data from various sources such as cameras, microphones, or sensor devices.

type.description: Data type to acquire: 1=image, 2=video (5 seconds), 3=audio, 4=sensor data

source.description: Source identifier: file path for existing files, or device number for cameras/microphones/sensors (e.g. '0' for camera 0)

para.description: Parameters in JSON format. For images/cameras: {"resolution": "640x320"}. For videos: {"resolution": "640x320", "duration": 5}. For audio: {"sampling_rate": 16000, "duration": 5}. For sensors: varies by sensor type.

duration.description: Duration in seconds for video/audio capture

sampling_rate.description: Sampling rate for audio capture (default: 16000 Hz)

run_claude.description: Run claude command using claude_shell.py as a separate process. This tool executes claude in a separate process and passes the working directory to claude_shell.py.

prompt.description: The prompt to send to claude

work_dir.description: Optional working directory path for claude_shell.py execution. If not specified, uses the workspace root directory.

mouse_control.description: Control mouse operations, including moving the mouse to a specified coordinate, single clicking the left mouse button, double clicking, right mouse button clicking, and scrolling the mouse wheel. This is a cross-platform mouse control tool that prioritizes using the PyAutoGUI or PyNput libraries, and falls back to system commands if those are not available.

action.description: Type of operation. Possible values: 'move' (move mouse), 'click' (single click), 'double_click' (double click), 'right_click' (right-button click), 'scroll' (scroll wheel).

x.description: X coordinate in pixels. Required for move, click, and scroll actions.

y.description: Y coordinate in pixels. Required for move, click, and scroll actions.

button.description: Mouse button type, only used when action='click'. Possible values: 'left', 'right'. Defaults to 'left'.

clicks.description: Number of clicks, only used when action='click'. Defaults to 1.

scroll_delta.description: Amount to scroll by, only used when action='scroll'. Positive for scroll up, negative for scroll down. Larger absolute values scroll more.

read_received_messages.description: Fetch messages from your own mailbox, including broadcast messages and P2P messages. Messages are automatically marked as read after retrieval.

send_status_update_to_manager.description: Send a status update from an agent to the manager about task progress.

agent_id.description: ID of the agent sending the update. ALWAYS use 'current_agent' to auto-detect the correct agent ID.

tool_calls_summary.description: List of tool names called in this round

current_task_description.description: Description of current task being worked on

error_message.description: Error message if any error occurred

idle.description: Idle tool that represents doing nothing in this round, only used for multi-agent synchronization. DO NOT use this for sending TASK_COMPLETED signal. This tool allows an agent to explicitly indicate that no action is needed in the current execution round. By default, it will sleep for 10 seconds to wait for other agents, monitoring the manager's inbox for new extmsg messages. If extmsg is detected, it will exit early. Otherwise waits for the full sleep duration. IMPORTANT: Set sleep to -1 for infinite sleep mode - this will only wake up when a user sends a message. This should ONLY be used when the manager has completed all tasks and there are no other active agents.

sleep.description: Sleep time in seconds (default: 10). Set to 0 to skip sleep. Set to -1 for infinite sleep mode (only wakes up when user sends a message) - ONLY use this when manager has completed all tasks and there are no other active agents.

recall_memories.description: Search and recall relevant memories from long-term memory based on semantic similarity. This tool implements RAG-like functionality to retrieve past experiences and knowledge.

query.description: The query to search for relevant memories. Can be a question, topic, or description of what you're looking for.

top_k.description: Number of most relevant memories to retrieve. Defaults to 5.

recall_memories_by_time.description: Search and recall memories from a specific time period. Useful for finding what happened 'yesterday', 'last week', or on a specific date.

time_query.description: Time-based query such as 'yesterday', 'last week', 'this month', or specific dates like '2024-01-01'

top_k.description: Number of memories to retrieve from that time period. Defaults to 5.

get_memory_summary.description: Get a summary of the long-term memory system status, including total number of memories, storage information, and system health.
